content.introduction: Understanding positive and negative numbers, their properties, and operations on integers.

topics.title: What are Integers?
topics.description: Integers include all whole numbers and their negatives: ...-3, -2, -1, 0, 1, 2, 3...
examples: Zero is neither positive nor negative

topics.title: Addition of Integers
topics.description: Rules for adding positive and negative integers.

topics.title: Subtraction of Integers
topics.description: Subtracting integers by adding the additive inverse.

topics.title: Multiplication and Division
topics.description: Rules for multiplying and dividing integers.

content.introduction: Understanding how plants make their own food through photosynthesis and different modes of nutrition in plants.

topics.title: Photosynthesis
topics.description: The process by which green plants make food using sunlight, carbon dioxide, and water.

topics.title: Conditions for Photosynthesis
examples: Carbon dioxide - from air through stomata

topics.title: Other Modes of Nutrition
examples: Parasites: Cuscuta (Amarbel) - depends on host plant
Saprophytes: Mushrooms - feed on dead matter
Insectivorous: Pitcher plant, Venus flytrap - trap insects

exercises: Define photosynthesis. Write its equation.
Name the raw materials needed for photosynthesis.
What is the role of chlorophyll?
How do leaves help in photosynthesis?
Explain parasitic nutrition with example.
Why are some plants called insectivorous?
Draw and label a leaf showing stomata.

content.introduction: A story by Leo Tolstoy about a king seeking answers to three important life questions.

topics.title: The Three Questions
topics.description: The king wanted to know: When is the right time? Who are the right people? What is the most important thing to do?
examples: Right time is NOW, Right person is with you, Right action is doing good

topics.title: Theme and Message
topics.description: The story teaches us about living in the present moment.
examples: Help person in front of you

exercises: What were the three questions?
Why did the king go to the hermit?
How did the hermit answer the questions?
What is the moral of the story?
Write the story in your own words
